name: homer
content:
homer noun [C]
(BASEBALL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
US informal short for
home run : a point scored in baseball when you hit the ball, usually out of the playing field, and are able to run around all the bases at one time to the starting base: hit a homer That season he hit 43 homers.
More examplesFewer examplesHe went out and hit two homers.Ruth's agent had agreed to donate the bat used for Ruth's first homer of the season.Every player with 200 or more homers has a dot on the map at his birthplace.

homer noun [C]
(JOB)
Scottish English informal a job that a skilled worker, such as a house painter or a hairdresser (= a person who cuts people's hair), does for a private customer in the customer's home, especially when they do this in addition to their main job and without telling their employer or the tax authorities: I am a fully qualified joiner looking for homers in the Renfrewshire area.
More examplesFewer examplesThis group is for local tradesmen looking for homers.
